name: Standard RFP Contract Template
description: Comprehensive RFP contract template for complex procurement projects requiring detailed proposals from vendors

parties.Buyer Address: Jl. Jenderal Gatot Subroto, Jakarta Selatan, DKI Jakarta 12950

scopeOfWork.Deliverables: [LIST ALL DELIVERABLES AS SPECIFIED IN RFP]
scopeOfWork.Technical Specifications: As detailed in RFP Document Annexure A

pricingTerms.Price Validity: Fixed price for contract duration unless otherwise specified
pricingTerms.Price Adjustment: Subject to agreed escalation clause after [SPECIFY PERIOD]
pricingTerms.Tax Treatment: Inclusive of VAT (11%), subject to PPh Article 23 (2%)
pricingTerms.Price Breakdown: As per attached Pricing Schedule (Annexure B)

paymentTerms.Payment Method: Bank Transfer to designated supplier account
paymentTerms.Payment Schedule: Net 30 days from invoice date and acceptance
paymentTerms.Progress Payment: Based on milestone completion and acceptance
paymentTerms.Final Payment: [PERCENTAGE]% upon final acceptance and warranty commencement
paymentTerms.Invoice Requirements: Tax invoice, delivery receipt, acceptance certificate
paymentTerms.Bank Details: To be provided by supplier before first payment

deliverySchedule.Acceptance Criteria: Visual inspection, functional testing, performance verification
deliverySchedule.Penalty for Late Delivery: 0.5% of milestone value per week, maximum 10% total
deliverySchedule.Force Majeure: As per Article XX of this contract

performanceGuarantee.Bank Guarantee: Issued by reputable Indonesian bank (List A)
performanceGuarantee.Warranty Period: 24 months from final acceptance (or as specified)
performanceGuarantee.Performance Standards: As per technical specifications in RFP
performanceGuarantee.Penalty for Non-Performance: As per penalty schedule in Annexure C
performanceGuarantee.Remediation Period: 30 days to cure defects after notification

terminationClauses.Termination for Cause: Either party may terminate upon 30 days written notice for material breach
terminationClauses.Material Breach Definition: Failure to meet critical milestones, quality standards, or payment obligations
terminationClauses.Termination for Convenience: Buyer may terminate with 60 days notice, payment for completed work
terminationClauses.Force Majeure: Performance excused for events beyond reasonable control (pandemic, natural disaster, war)
terminationClauses.Consequences of Termination: Return of materials, payment for completed work, transfer of documentation
terminationClauses.Dispute Resolution: Mediation (30 days), then arbitration under BANI rules
terminationClauses.Governing Law: Laws of the Republic of Indonesia
terminationClauses.Notices: In writing to registered addresses, deemed received after 3 business days

legalTerms.Confidentiality: All project information to remain confidential for 5 years post-completion
legalTerms.Intellectual Property: Supplier retains existing IP, Buyer receives perpetual license for deliverables
legalTerms.Liability Cap: Limited to total contract value except for willful misconduct or gross negligence
legalTerms.Insurance Requirements: Professional liability $1M, Product liability $1M, Workers compensation
legalTerms.Compliance: All applicable Indonesian laws, TKDN regulations, environmental laws
legalTerms.Anti-Corruption: Zero tolerance policy, compliance with FCPA and UKBA
legalTerms.Data Protection: Compliance with Indonesian Personal Data Protection Law
legalTerms.Audit Rights: Buyer may audit supplier records related to contract performance
legalTerms.Subcontracting: Requires prior written approval from Buyer

specialConditions.Local Content: Minimum [PERCENTAGE]% TKDN (Tingkat Komponen Dalam Negeri) required
specialConditions.Technology Transfer: Knowledge transfer and training for Indonesian personnel (minimum [HOURS] hours)
specialConditions.Safety Requirements: Compliance with Indonesian K3L (Occupational Health and Safety) regulations
specialConditions.Community Development: CSR contribution [PERCENTAGE]% of contract value to local communities
specialConditions.Reporting Requirements: Monthly progress reports, quarterly financial reports, risk registers
specialConditions.Change Management: All changes require written approval and may affect price and timeline
specialConditions.Quality Assurance: QA/QC plan approval required before commencement
specialConditions.Escalation Procedures: Defined escalation matrix for issues and disputes

required_annexures: Annexure A: Technical Specifications and Requirements
Annexure B: Pricing Schedule and Payment Milestones
Annexure C: Penalty Schedule and Liquidated Damages
Annexure D: Performance Bond Format
Annexure E: Insurance Certificates
Annexure F: Delivery and Acceptance Procedures
Annexure G: Quality Assurance Plan
Annexure H: Environmental Management Plan
